columns.text: In this exercise, we are to determine the required values used for the preparation of the pro forma balance sheet. We are also to determine the amount of the new borrowing algebraically.

## Financial Planning
\
Financial planning is referred to as the systematic method of the attainment of the company's financial goals. It indicates the actions and decisions to be done in the future for the company.

## Pro Forma Statements
\
Pro Forma statements include a forecasted balance sheet, an income statement, and a statement of cash flows. These financial statements are necessary for the determination of the summary of projected events in the succeeding years of operation of the firm.
\
The pro forma statements are considered outputs of the financial plan. The management would estimate the projected and would then produce the pro forma statements.

## Required (a)
\
Now, let us calculate the required values necessary in the preparation of the pro forma balance sheet using the following given:
 

<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Income Statement||
|$\hspace{20pt}$Sales|\$780,000|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Cost|\$415,000|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Depreciation|\$135,000|
|$\hspace{30pt}$Interest|\$68,000|
|$\hspace{40pt}$Taxable Income|\$162,000|
|$\hspace{40pt}$Taxes (21\%)|\$34,020|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Net Income|\$127,980|
|Dividends|\$30,000|
|Addition to Retained Earnings|\$97,980|

The accounts in the balance sheet are as follows:
 
<center>

|Given||
|:--|--:|
|Current Assets|\$240,000|
|Net Fixed Assets|\$1,350,000|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Total Assets|\$1,590,000|
|Total Debt|\$880,000|
|Total Equity|\$710,000|
|$\hspace{20pt}$Total Debt and Equity|\$1,590,000|

## Cost Percentage
\
The cost percentage is determined by dividing the cost by the sales. 
 
$$\text{Cost Percentage}=\frac{\text{Costs}}{\text{Sales}}$$

## Depreciation Rate
\
The depreciation rate is determined by dividing the depreciation amount by the beginning fixed assets.
 
$$\text{Depreciation Rate}=\frac{\text{Depreciation}}{\text{Beginning Fixed Assets}}$$

## Interest Rate
\
The interest rate is determined by dividing the interest paid by the total debt.
 
$$\text{Interest Rate}=\frac{\text{Interest Paid}}{\text{Total Debt}}$$

## Tax Rate
\
The tax rate is determined by dividing the taxes paid by the net income.
 
$$\text{Tax Rate}=\frac{\text{Taxes Paid}}{\text{Net Income}}$$
 
**The tax rate as provided in the given in the problem is 21\%.**

## Dividend Payout Ratio
\
The dividend payout ratio is determined by dividing the dividends by the net income.
 
$$\text{Payout Ratio}=\frac{\text{Dividend}}{\text{Net Income}}$$

## Capital Intensity Ratio
\
The capital intensity ratio is determined by dividing the fixed assets by the sales.
 
$$\text{Capital Intensity Ratio}=\frac{\text{Fixed Assets}}{\text{Sales}}$$

## Fixed Assets Ratio
\
The fixed assets ratio is determined by dividing the fixed assets by the net income.
 
$$\text{Fixed Assets Ratio}=\frac{\text{Fixed Assets}}{\text{Total Assets}}$$

## Required (b)
\
Now, let us prepare the pro forma statements.

**The cost percentage as computed in step 7 is 53\%.**
\
Now, let us compute the projected cost:
 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Projected Cost}&=\text{Projected Sales}\times\text{Rate}\\[12pt]
&={\$936,000}\times{53\%}\\[12pt]
&=\boxed{\$496,080}\\
\end{aligned}$$
 
**The projected cost is \$496,080.**

**The capital intensity ratio as computed in step 16 is 1.73**
\
Now, let us compute the projected total assets:
 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Projected Total Assets}&=\text{Projected Sales}\times\text{Rate}\\[12pt]
&={\$936,000}\times{1.73}\\[12pt]
&=\boxed{\$1,620,000}\\
\end{aligned}$$
 
**The projected total assets is \$1,620,000.**

**The fixed assets ratio as computed in step 18 is 0.85**
\
Now, let us compute the projected fixed assets:
 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Projected Fixed Assets}&=\text{Projected Total Assets}\times\text{Rate}\\[12pt]
&={\$1,620,000}\times{0.85}\\[12pt]
&=\boxed{\$1,375,471.70}\\
\end{aligned}$$
 
**The projected fixed assets is \$1,375,471.70.**

**The depreciation rate as computed in step 9 is 0.10**
\
Now, let us compute the projected Depreciation:
 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Projected Depreciation}&=\text{Fixed Assets}\times\text{Rate}\\[12pt]
&={\$1,375,471.70}\times{10\%}\\[12pt]
&=\boxed{\$137,547.17}\\
\end{aligned}$$
 
**The projected Depreciation is \$137,547.17.**

Now, let us compute the total equity:
 
$$\begin{aligned} \text{Predicted Equity}&=\text{Total Equity}+\text{Additional Retained Earnings}\\[12pt]
&={\$710,000}+{\$113,433.23}\\[12pt] 
&=\boxed{\$823,433.23}\\ \end{aligned}$$
 
**The projected total equity amounts to $823,433.23.**

Now, let us compute the total debt:
 
$$\begin{aligned} \text{Predicted Debt}&=\text{Total Debt and Equity}-\text{Total Equity}\\[12pt]
&={\$1,620,000}-{\$823,433.23}\\[12pt] 
&=\boxed{\$796,566.77}\\ \end{aligned}$$
 
**The projected total debt amounts to $796,566.77.**

**The interest rate as computed in step 11 is 8\%**
\
Now, let us compute the projected Depreciation:
 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Projected Interest}&=\text{Total Debt}\times\text{Rate}\\[12pt]
&={\$796,566.77}\times{8\%}\\[12pt]
&=\boxed{\$61,552.89}\\
\end{aligned}$$
 
**The projected interest is \$61,552.89.**

Now, let us compute the projected taxable income:
 
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Projected Taxable Income}&=\text{Projected Sales}-\text{Projected Cost}\\[5pt]
&-\text{Projected Depreciation}-\text{Interest}\\[12pt]
&={\$936,000}-{\$496,080}\\[5pt]
&-{\$137,547.17}-{\$61,552.89}\\[12pt]
&=\boxed{\$238,899.94}\\
\end{aligned}$$
 
**The projected Taxable income is \$238,899.94.**

Now, let us prepare the pro forma income statement:
 
$$\textbf{Pro Forma}\\
\textbf{Income Statement}$$

$$\begin{array}{l r}
\text{Sales}&{\$936,000}\\
\text{Cost}&{496,080}\\
\text{Depreciation}&{137,547.17}\\
\text{Interest Paid}&\underline{61,552.89}\\
\hspace{20pt}\text{Taxable Income}&{\$238,899.94}\\
\hspace{20pt}\text{Taxes}&\underline{81,225.98}\\
\hspace{30pt}\textbf{Net Income}&\underline{\underline{\textbf{\$}\textbf{157,673.96}}}\\
\end{array}$$

## Required (c)
\
Now, let us determine the amount of new borrowing.
\
The problem uses a circular logic which means that to arrive at a computed amount, the other amounts should be determined first. In this case, an excel computation is recommended to be used to determine the amounts.

The computation of the new borrowing is as follows:
 
$$\begin{aligned} \text{Predicted Debt}&=\text{Total Debt and Equity}-\text{Total Equity}\\[12pt]
&={\$1,620,000}-{\$823,433.23}\\[12pt] 
&=\boxed{\$796,566.77}\\ \end{aligned}$$
 
**The projected total debt amounts to $796,566.77.**
The problem will require us to calculate the necessary parameters, construct the pro forma balance sheet, the amount of debt required to borrow, and compute the amount of new borrowing using algebra.

## Requirement 1.

Now we can start calculating the different parameters.

a. Cost percentage.

b. Depreciation rate.

c. Interest rate.

d. Tax rate.

e. Payout ratio.

f. Capital intensity ratio.

g. Fixed assets ratio.

### Compute the cost percentage.

The cost percentage is the share of the cost of sales to the sales.

The formula is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\text{Cost Percentage}&= \dfrac{\text{Cost of Sales}}{\text{Sales}}\\[15pt]

&=\dfrac{\$415,000}{\$780,000}\\[15pt]

&= 0.5321 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{53.21\%}}

\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the cost percentage is **53.21%**.

### Compute the depreciation rate.

The depreciation rate is the percentage rate used in depreciating the fixed assets.

The formula is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\text{Depreciation Rate}&= \dfrac{\text{Depreciation}}{\text{Beg Fixed Assets}}\\[15pt]

&=\dfrac{\$135,000}{\$1,350,000}\\[15pt]

&= 0.10 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{10\%}}

\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the depreciation rate is **10%**.

### Compute the interest rate.

The interest rate is the percentage rate used in calculating the interest expense of the company.

The formula is as follows.
$$
\begin{aligned}
\text{Interest Rate}&= \dfrac{\text{Interest Expense}}{\text{Total Debt}}\\[15pt]

&=\dfrac{\$68,000}{\$880,000}\\[15pt]

&= 0.0773 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{7.73\%}}

\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the interest rate is **7.73%**.

### Compute the tax rate. 

The tax rate is the percentage used in calculating the business tax of the company. 

The formula is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\text{Tax Rate}&= \dfrac{\text{Taxes}}{\text{Taxable Income}}\\[15pt]

&=\dfrac{\$34,020}{\$162,000}\\[15pt]

&= 0.21 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{21\%}}

\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the tax rate is **21%**.

### Compute the payout ratio.

The payout ratio is the percentage used in determining the rate assigned explicitly to the declared dividends.

The formula is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\text{Payout Ratio}&= \dfrac{\text{Declared Dividends}}{\text{Net Income}}\\[15pt]

&=\dfrac{\$30,000}{\$127,980}\\[15pt]

&= 0.2344 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{23.44\%}}

\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the payout ratio is **23.44%**.

### Compute the fixed asset ratio.

The fixed asset ratio is the percentage of fixed assets from the total assets.
The formula is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\text{Fixed Asset Ratio}&= \dfrac{\text{Fixed Asset}}{\text{Total Assets}}\\[15pt]

&=\dfrac{\$1,350,000}{\$1,590,000}\\[15pt]

&= 0.8491 \times 100\\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{84.91\%}}

\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the fixed asset ratio is **84.91%**.

## Requirement 2.


### Prepare a pro forma balance and compute the necessary debt.


The projected sales growth for the next year is at 20%.

### Compute the interest expense.

There is no expected new borrowing for the next fiscal year. Therefore the interest expense for next year will be the same as the current year of **$68,000.00.**

### Compute the taxable income.

The taxable income will be the basis of the tax expense.


$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\text{Sales}&\$936,000.00\\
\text{Cost}&498,045.60\\
\text{Depreciation}&162,008.20\\
\text{Interest}&\underline{68,000.00}\\
\text{Taxable Income}&\$207,946.20\\

\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the taxable income is **$207,946.20**.

### Prepare the income statement.

Now that projected sales, cost of sales, depreciation, and interest are now given, we can now compute the 
$$
\begin{array}{c}
\textbf{Income Statement}
\end{array}
$$
$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\text{Sales}&\$936,000.00\\
\text{Cost}&498,045.60\\
\text{Depreciation}&162,008.20\\
\text{Interest}&\underline{68,000.00}\\
\text{Taxable Income}&\$207,946.20\\
\text{Taxes}&\underline{43,668.70}\\
\text{Net Income}&\underline{\underline{\$164,277.50}}\\
\\

\end{array}
$$

Therefore, the net income is **$164,277.50**.

### Compute the EFN.

The EFN (external financing needed) is the amount necessary to support the company's projected growth.


$$
\begin{array}{lr}
\text{Projected Assets}&\$1,908,000.00\\
\text{Less:}\\
\hspace{5pt}\text{Debt}&880,000.00\\
\hspace{5pt}\text{Projected Equity}&\underline{835,770.85}\\
\textbf{External Financing Needed}&\$192,229.15\\

\end{array}
$$


Therefore, the external financing needed is **$192,229.15**.

## Requirement c.

### Easily compute the EFN.

The first step is to compute the projected assets; then, we deduct the projected equity (calculated in previous cells).

$$
\begin{aligned}
\text{EFN}&= \text{Total Assets} - \text{Debt} - \text{Projected Equity}\\[15pt]

&=\$1,908,000.00 -\$880,000.00- \$835.770.85\\[15pt]




&= \boxed{\textbf{\$192,229.15}}

\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the total EFN is **$192,229.15**.
